STATE OF MICHIGAN
DEPARTMENT OF HEALTH AND HUMAN SERVICES
GRETCHEN WHITMER
LANS ING
ELIZABETH HERTEL
GOVERNOR DIRECTOR
April 24, 2023
Jamie L Lemay
MARQUETTE/ALGER/SCHOOLCRAFT MDHHS
234 W BARAGA AVE,
MARQUETTE, MI, 49855-4710
Re: License #: CP520201281
SIR#: 2023C0000202
Dear Ms. Lemay:
Attached is the Special Investigation Report for the above referenced facility. Due to the
violations identified in the report, a written corrective action plan is required. The
corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter and must include the
following:
• How compliance with each rule will be achieved.
• For any repeat violations, why the prior corrective action plan did not result
in compliance.
• Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
violation.
• Specific time frames for each violation as to when the action steps will be
completed or implemented.
• How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
• The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you desire technical assistance in addressing these issues, please feel free to contact
me. In any event, the corrective action plan is due within 15 days. Failure to submit an
acceptable corrective action plan will result in disciplinary action.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available, and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact the area manager at (866) 685-0006.
Sincerely,
Mark Hunter, Licensing Consultant
P.O. BOX 30650 • LANSING, MICHIGAN 48909
www.michigan.gov • (517) 335-1980

III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code & CPA Rule 400.12417 Foster Parent Information.
Section (1) An agency shall provide a foster parent with all of the following
Description information before the placement or replacement of a child:
1

(d) Any known history of abuse or neglect of the child.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation Foster parent not informed of all child's history of abuse.
Investigation I interviewed Complainant 1 by telephone on 2/2/2023.
Complainant 1 stated Foster Parent 1 reported that Foster Parent
1 was not informed of the human trafficking history experienced by
Youth A prior to Youth A's placement in Foster Parent 1's home.
I interviewed Administrator 1 by telephone on 2/2/2023 and
scheduled a virtual interview for 2/06/2023. I completed a virtual
interview 2/06/2023 involving Administrator 1, Foster Care
Supervisor 1, Foster Care Worker 1, Administrator 2, and Analyst
1. They reported Youth A was placed with Foster Parent 1 after
Youth A was picked up from being AWOL from Youth A's
residential treatment program for human trafficking youth. They
reported discussing Youth A's issues with Foster Parent 1 at the
time Youth A was placed with Foster Parent 1. They stated they
thought Foster Parent 1 worked well with Youth A and stated they
had no complaints regarding Foster Parent 1's attempts to help
Youth A. They indicated Foster Parent 1 went above and beyond
in attempting to provide an appropriate placement to meet the
needs of Youth A. An example provided was that Foster Parent 1
was willing to take Youth A back for a temporary placement
following Youth A's truancy from the home of Foster Parent 1.
The agency staff indicated they thought Foster Parent 1 was
informed of the human trafficking history of Youth A since the
residential program Youth A was truant from specialized in human
trafficking victims and a special rate of reimbursement was
developed for Foster Parent 1 due the unique needs of Youth A.
I interviewed Foster Parent 1 by telephone on 2/28/2023. Foster
Parent 1 stated she was informed Youth A had been truant from a
residential placement but was not aware the program specialized
in human trafficking victims. Foster Parent 1 stated she was
informed Youth A had been sexually assaulted but was unaware
of the human trafficking history. Foster Parent 1 stated she was
informed Youth A experienced two broken adoptions but was
unaware of the human trafficking.
The information record for Youth A was reviewed. The
information documented indicated a number of other entities were
informed regarding the human trafficking history when the agency
2

was attempting to locate an appropriate placement for Youth A.
However, Foster Parent 1 was not included in these
communications. Subsequent contacts with Foster Parent 1 also
did not indicate Foster Parent 1 was informed prior to the
placement of Youth A in the home of Foster Parent 1.
Analysis The record indicates there was a great deal of communication
between agency staff and Foster Parent 1 regarding Youth A.
The record indicates Youth A is a very difficult case reflecting the
history and behaviors of Youth A. The documentation provided in
the record is insufficient to determine Foster Parent 1 was
informed of the human trafficking history of Youth A prior to Youth
A being placed in the home of Foster Parent 1.
Conclusion Violation Established
Rule Code & CPA Rule 400.12417 Foster Parent Information.
Section (1) An agency shall provide a foster parent with all of the following
Description information before the placement or replacement of a child:
(h) Any other known information to enable the foster parent to
provide a stable, safe, and healthy environment for the foster child
and the foster family, including information about siblings who do
not reside in the foster home.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation Foster Parent not informed of youth's human trafficking history.
Investigation Refer to content from part (d) of same rule noted above. All
content applies to this section of the rule as well.
Analysis The record indicates there was a great deal of communication
between agency staff and Foster Parent 1 regarding Youth A. The
record indicates Youth A is a very difficult case reflecting the
history and behaviors of Youth A. The documentation provided in
the record is insufficient to determine Foster Parent 1 was
informed of the human trafficking history of Youth A prior to Youth
A being placed in the home of Foster Parent 1.
Conclusion Violation Established
Rule Code & CPA Rule 400.12421
Section (1) An agency shall have a policy regarding visitation and
Description parenting time that contains, at a minimum, all of the following:
3

(b) An agency social service worker shall visit the foster child
and the foster parent in the foster parent’s home at least once
every month.
Violation Additional Findings of Non-Compliance
Type
Allegation Social Worker did not complete the required foster home visits.
with the youth.
Investigation I interviewed Administrator 1 by telephone on 2/2/2023 and
completed a virtual interview with Administrator 1, Administrator 2,
Foster Care Supervisor 1, Foster Care Worker 1, and Analyst 1 on
2/06/2023. They reported that face to face contact at the foster
home with Youth A had been completed as required by this rule.
I interviewed Foster Parent 1 by telephone on 2/28/2023. Foster
Parent 1 stated the foster care worker had visited the foster home
three different times while Youth A was in the home of Foster
Parent 1.
I reviewed the foster care record for Youth A. The record
indicated Youth A was placed in the home of Foster Parent 1 from
10/21/2022 to 11/23/2022 and 12/29/2022 to 1/03/2023. The
social work contacts documented face to face contact with Youth
A at the placement location of Youth A by the worker on
10/21/2022, 10/24/2022, 11/23/2022, 12/12/2022, 12/19/2022,
1/09/2023, and 1/31/2023. Youth A was not in the specific foster
home during some dates identified, but the dates
indicate/substantiate Youth A was visited in their placement
location as required by the rule.
Analysis Foster Parent 1 stated the worker did visit the foster home three
different times when Youth A was placed in this home. The record
for Youth A indicated the worker did have face to face contact with
Youth A at Youth A's placement location at least monthly as
required by this rule.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
4

IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is not in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. Upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, it
is recommended that the current license status be continued.
______________________________________04/24/2023
Mark Hunter Date
Licensing Consultant
Approved By:
